Type.Name: XmlTextReader

TypeSignature.Value: public class XmlTextReader : System.Xml.XmlReader, Mono.Xml.IHasXmlParserContext, System.Xml.IXmlLineInfo, System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Represents a reader that provides fast, non-cached, forward-only access to XML data.

remarks.para: This class provides forward-only, read-only access to a character stream of XML data. This class enforces the rules of well-formed XML but does not perform data validation.
This class implements the class and conforms to the W3C Extensible Markup Language (XML) 1.0 and the Namespaces in XML recommendations.

A given set of XML data is modeled as a tree of nodes. The different types of nodes are specified in the enumeration. The current node refers to the node on which the reader is positioned. The reader is advanced using any of the "read" or "moveto" methods. The following table lists the node properties exposed for the current node.

item.description: The number of attributes on the node.
The base URI of the node.
The depth of the node in the tree.
Whether the node has attributes. (Inherited from )
Whether the node can have a text value.
Whether an node was generated from the default value defined in the DTD or schema.
Whether an node is empty.
The local name of the node.
The qualified name of the node, equal to : .
The URI defining the namespace associated with the node.
The of the node.
A shorthand reference to the namespace associated with the node.
The quotation mark character used to enclose the value of an attribute.
The text value of the node.
The xml:lang scope within which the node resides.

remarks.para:
This class does not expand default attributes or resolve general entities. Any general entities encountered are returned as a single empty
node.
This class checks that a Document Type Definition (DTD) is well-formed, but does not validate using the DTD.
To read strongly typed data, use the class.

This class throws a on XML parse errors. After an exception is thrown, the state of the reader is not predictable. For example, the reported node type can be different than the actual node type of the current node.

MemberSignature.Value: .property int32 AttributeCount { public hidebysig virtual specialname int32 get_AttributeCount() }

summary.para: Gets the number of attributes on the current node.

value.para: A containing the number of attributes on the current node, or zero if the current node does not support attributes.

remarks.para: This property is read-only.

block.para: This property is relevant to the , , and node types of the enumeration. Other node types do not have attributes.

MemberSignature.Value: .property string BaseURI { public hidebysig virtual specialname string get_BaseURI() }

summary.para: Gets the base Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the current node.

value.para: The base URI of the current node.

remarks.para: This property is read-only.
This property is set when the reader is instantiated and defaults to .

block.para: A networked XML document is comprised of chunks of data aggregated using various W3C standard inclusion mechanisms and therefore contains nodes that come from different places. Document Type Definition (DTD) entities are an example of this, but this is not limited to DTDs. The base URI tells where these nodes come from.

summary.para: Changes the to .

remarks.para:
This method releases any resources allocated by the current instance, changes the to , and calls the method of any underlying or
instance.

remarks.para: This property is read-only.

remarks.para: This method does not move the reader.

Docs.exception:
is less than 0, or greater than or equal to the of the containing element.
returns zero for all node types except , , , and . Therefore, this exception is thrown if the reader is not positioned on one of these node types.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.IO.TextReader GetRemainder()

summary.para: Returns the remainder of the buffered XML.

remarks.para: This method calls the method, and then resets the to .

block.para: Because performs a buffered read operation, it must be able to return the remainder of the unused buffer so that no data is lost. For example, this allows protocols (such as multi-part MIME) to package XML in the same stream.

A node is not generated for empty elements.

MemberSignature.Value: .property int32 LineNumber { public final hidebysig virtual specialname int32 get_LineNumber() }

summary.para: Gets the current line number.

value.para: A containing the current line number.

remarks.para: This property is read-only.
The constructors initialize this property to one.

block.para: This property is most commonly used for error reporting, but can be called at any time.
The start of a document is indicated when this property is 1 and the property is 1.

MemberSignature.Value: .property int32 LinePosition { public final hidebysig virtual specialname int32 get_LinePosition() }

summary.para: Gets the current position in a line.

value.para: A containing the current line position.

remarks.para: This property is read-only.
The constructors initialize this property to one, which indicates the first character of text in a line.

block.para: For example, <root>, contains the character 'r' at equal to 2 and the character '>' at equal to 6.
This property is most commonly used for error reporting, but can be called at any time.
The start of a document is indicated when this property is 1 and the property is 1.

MemberSignature.Value: .property string LocalName { public hidebysig virtual specialname string get_LocalName() }

summary.para: Gets the local name of the current node.

value.para: A containing the local name of the current node or, for node types that do not have a name (like , , and so on), .

remarks.para: This property is read-only.
The local name is equivalent to with and the ':' character removed. For example, is "book" for the element <bk:book>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual string LookupNamespace(string prefix)

Docs.param: A specifying the prefix whose namespace URI is to be resolved. To return the default namespace, specify .

summary.para: Resolves a namespace prefix in the scope of the current element.

returns.para: A containing the namespace URI to which the prefix maps. If is , is not in , or no matching namespace is found, is returned.

block.para: In the following XML, if the reader is positioned on the href attribute, the prefix "a" is resolved by calling ("a"). The returned string is "urn:456".

Docs.exception: The property of the current instance is and is .

remarks.para: After calling this method, the , , and properties reflect the properties of the new attribute.

is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the of the containing element.
returns zero for all node types except , , , and . Therefore, this exception is thrown if the reader is not positioned on one of these node types.

returns.para: A where indicates the attribute was found. If is , or the attribute was not found, is returned and the position of the reader does not change.

remarks.para: After calling this method, the , , and properties reflect the properties of the new attribute.

remarks.para: If is , the local namespace is searched for .
After calling this method, the , , and properties reflect the properties of the new attribute.

summary.para: Moves the position of the current instance to the node that contains the current node.

returns.para: A where indicates the reader was moved; indicates the reader was not positioned on an node and therefore was not moved.

block.para: The , , and node types can contain attributes.

summary.para: Moves the position of the current instance to the first attribute associated with the current node.

returns.para: A where indicates the current node contains at least one attribute; otherwise, .

remarks.para: If is non-zero, the reader moves to the first attribute; otherwise, the position of the reader does not change.

summary.para: Moves the position of the current instance to the next attribute associated with the current node.

returns.para: A where indicates the reader moved to the next attribute; if there were no more attributes.

remarks.para: If the current node is an element node, this method is equivalent to .

MemberSignature.Value: .property string Name { public hidebysig virtual specialname string get_Name() }

summary.para: Gets the qualified name of the current node.

value.para: A containing the qualified name of the current node or, for node types that do not have a name (like , , and so on), .

remarks.para: This property is read-only.
The name returned is dependent on the of the node. The following node types return the listed values. All other node types return an empty string.

item.description: The name of the attribute.
The document type name.
The tag name.
The name of the entity referenced.
The target of the processing instruction.
The literal string "xml".

block.para: The qualified name is equivalent to the prefixed with and the ':' character. For example, is "bk:book" for the element <bk:book>.

MemberSignature.Value: .property bool Namespaces { public hidebysig specialname instance bool get_Namespaces() public hidebysig specialname instance void set_Namespaces(bool value) }

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the reader supports namespaces.

value.para: A where indicates the reader supports namespaces; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.para: This property determines whether the reader supports the XML Namespaces specification (http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml-names). If this property is , namespaces are ignored and the reader allows names to contain multiple colon characters.
If an attempt is made to set this property after a read operation has occurred, a is thrown.

Docs.exception: When attempting to set the property, the was not .

MemberSignature.Value: .property string NamespaceURI { public hidebysig virtual specialname string get_NamespaceURI() }

summary.para: Gets the namespace URI associated with the node on which the reader is positioned.

value.para: A containing the namespace URI of the current node or, if no namespace URI is associated with the current node, .

remarks.para: This property is read-only.
This property is relevant to and nodes only.

block.para: Namespaces conform to the W3C "Namespaces in XML" recommendation, REC-xml-names-19990114.

MemberSignature.Value: .property class System.Xml.XmlNameTable NameTable { public hidebysig virtual specialname class System.Xml.XmlNameTable get_NameTable() }

summary.para: Gets the name table used by the current instance to store and look up element and attribute names, prefixes, and namespaces.

value.para: The used by the current instance.

remarks.para: This property is read-only.
The class stores element and attribute names, prefixes, and namespaces as individual objects when a document is read.

A qualified name is stored as a unique instance and separated into its prefix and local name parts, which are also stored as unique strings instances. For example, <somePrefix:someElement>, is stored as three strings, "somePrefix:someElement", "somePrefix", and "someElement".

MemberSignature.Value: .property valuetype System.Xml.XmlNodeType NodeType { public hidebysig virtual specialname valuetype System.Xml.XmlNodeType get_NodeType() }

summary.para: Gets the of the current node.

value.para: One of the members of the enumeration representing the type of the current node.

remarks.para: This property is read-only.
This property does not return the following types: , , , , or .

MemberSignature.Value: .property bool Normalization { public hidebysig specialname instance bool get_Normalization() public hidebysig specialname instance void set_Normalization(bool value) }

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to normalize white space and attribute values.

value.para: A where indicates to normalize; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.para: This property can be changed at any time before the current instance has been closed and takes affect on the next read operation.
If is set to , this also disables character range checking for numeric entities. As a result, character entities, such as " &#0", are allowed.

block.para: See "Attribute-Value Normalization" in the W3C XML 1.0 recommendation, REC-xml-19980210.

Docs.exception: When attempting to set the property, the current instance has been closed.

MemberSignature.Value: .property string Prefix { public hidebysig virtual specialname string get_Prefix() }

summary.para: Gets the namespace prefix associated with the current node.

value.para: A containing the namespace prefix associated with the current node.

remarks.para: This property is read-only.

block.para: A namespace prefix is used as a reference for a namespace URI and is defined in an element declaration. For example, <someElement xmlns:bk='someURL'>, defines a prefix name "bk".

MemberSignature.Value: .property valuetype System.Char QuoteChar { public hidebysig virtual specialname valuetype System.Char get_QuoteChar() }

summary.para: Gets the quotation mark character used to enclose the value of an attribute.

value.para: A specifying the quotation mark character (" or ') used to enclose the value of an attribute.

remarks.para: This property is read-only.
This property applies only to an node.

summary.para: Moves the position of the current instance to the next node in the stream, exposing its properties.

returns.para: A where indicates the node was read successfully, and indicates there were no more nodes to read.

block.para: When a reader is first created and initialized, there is no information available. Calling this method is required to read the first node.

Docs.exception: An error occurred while parsing the XML.

summary.para: Parses an attribute value into one or more and nodes.

returns.para: A where indicates the attribute value was parsed, and indicates the reader was not positioned on an attribute node or all the attribute values have been read.

remarks.para: The class does not expand general entities; any encountered are returned as a single empty node ( is ).

block.para: Use this method after calling to read through the text or entity reference nodes that make up the attribute value. The of the attribute value nodes is one plus the depth of the attribute node. When general entity references are stepped into or out of, the is incremented of decremented by one, respectively.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 ReadBase64(class System.Byte[] array, int32 offset, int32 len)
public int ReadBase64 (byte[] buffer, int offset, int length);

Docs.param: A specifying the zero-based index into where the method should begin to write.

summary.para: Reads and decodes the Base64 encoded contents of an element and stores the result in a byte buffer.

returns.para: A containing the number of bytes written to , or zero if the current instance is not positioned on an element.

block.para: This method can be called successively to read large streams of embedded text.
Base64 encoding represents byte sequences in a text form comprised of the 65 US-ASCII characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9, +, /, =) where each character encodes 6 bits of the binary data.
For more information on Base64 encoding, see RFC 2045 (http://www.ietf.org/rfc/2045).

Docs.exception: The Base64 sequence is not valid.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 ReadBinHex(class System.Byte[] array, int32 offset, int32 len)
public int ReadBinHex (byte[] buffer, int offset, int length);

Docs.param: A specifying the zero-based index into where the method should begin to write.

summary.para: Reads and decodes the BinHex encoded contents of an element and stores the result in a byte buffer.

returns.para: A containing the number of bytes written to , or zero if the current instance is not positioned on an element.

block.para: This method can be called successively to read large streams of embedded text.
For information on BinHex encoding, see RFC 1741 (http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1741).

Docs.exception: The BinHex sequence is not valid.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 ReadChars(class System.Char[] buffer, int32 index, int32 count)
public int ReadChars (char[] buffer, int offset, int length);

Docs.param: A array to store the content.

summary.para: Reads the text contents of an element into a character buffer.

returns.para: A containing the number of characters written to , or zero if the current instance is not positioned on an element.

remarks.para: If the end of the character stream in the element is reached before the specified number of characters is read, the return value will be less than .
This method has the following functionality:

item.term: It is designed to work on element nodes only; it returns zero for other node types.
It returns the actual character content including markup. There is no attempt to resolve entities, CDATA, or any other markup encountered.
It ignores XML markup that is not well-formed. For example, when reading the following XML string 12, 12 is returned. (It returns markup from the matching element pair and ignores others.)
It does not do any normalization.
When it has reached the end of the character stream, the reader is positioned after the end tag.
Attribute read methods are not available.

block.para: Using this method is the most efficient way to process very large streams of text embedded in an XML document. Rather than allocating large string objects, this method returns text content a buffer at a time.

MemberSignature.Value: public override int ReadContentAsBase64 (byte[] buffer, int offset, int length);
public override int ReadContentAsBinHex (byte[] buffer, int offset, int length);
public override int ReadElementContentAsBase64 (byte[] buffer, int offset, int length);

.property valuetype System.Xml.ReadState ReadState { public hidebysig virtual specialname valuetype System.Xml.ReadState get_ReadState() }

summary.para: Gets the read state of the reader.

value.para: One of the members of the enumeration.

remarks.para: This property is read-only.

summary.para: Reads the contents of an element or a text node as a string.

returns.para: A containing the contents of the or node, or if the reader is positioned on any other type of node.

remarks.para:
If positioned on an node, this method concatenates all , , , and node types, and returns the concatenated data as the element content. If none of these node types exist,
is returned. Concatenation stops when any markup is encountered, which can occur in a mixed content model or when an element end tag is read.

If positioned on an element node, this method performs the same concatenation from the node to the element end tag. If the reader is positioned on an attribute node, this method has the same functionality as if the reader were position on the element start tag.

Docs.exception: An error occurred while parsing the XML.

summary.para: Resets the to .

remarks.para: The , , , and properties are not changed by this method.

block.para: This method enables the parsing of multiple XML documents in a single stream. When the end of an XML document is reached, this method resets the state of the current instance in preparation for the next XML document.

Docs.exception: The current instance was constructed with a .

summary.para: Resolves the entity reference for nodes.

MemberSignature.Value: .property string Value { public hidebysig virtual specialname string get_Value() }

summary.para: Gets the text value of the current node.

value.para: A containing the text value of the current node.

remarks.para: This property is read-only.
The value returned depends on the . The following table lists node types that have a value to return. All other node types return .

item.description: The value of the attribute.
The content of the CDATA section.
The content of the comment.
The internal subset.
The entire content, excluding the target.
The white space in the scope of xml:space = "preserve".

description.para: The content of the text node.

item.description: The white space between markup.
The content of the declaration.

MemberSignature.Value: .property valuetype System.Xml.WhitespaceHandling WhitespaceHandling { public hidebysig specialname instance valuetype System.Xml.WhitespaceHandling get_WhitespaceHandling() public hidebysig specialname instance void set_WhitespaceHandling(valuetype System.Xml.WhitespaceHandling value) }

summary.para: Gets or sets a value that specifies the type of white space returned by the reader.

value.para: One of the members of the enumeration. The default is (returns both significant and insignificant white space).

remarks.para: This property can be changed at any time before the current instance is closed and takes affect on the next read operation.

block.para: Because an instance of the class does not have DTD information available to it, nodes are only returned within the xml:space="preserve" scope.

Docs.exception: The value to be set is not one of the members of the enumeration.
When setting the property, the is .

MemberSignature.Value: .property string XmlLang { public hidebysig virtual specialname string get_XmlLang() }

summary.para: Gets the current xml:lang scope.

value.para: A containing the current xml:lang scope.

remarks.para: This property is read-only.

block.para:
This property represents the xml:lang scope within which the current node resides. For example, the following is an XML fragment with xml:lang
set to US English:
When the reader is positioned on the name element, this property returns "en-us".
The returned string is also in the for the reader.

MemberSignature.Value: .property class System.Xml.XmlResolver XmlResolver { public hidebysig specialname instance void set_XmlResolver(class System.Xml.XmlResolver value) }

summary.para: Sets the used for resolving DTD references.

value.para: The to use for resolving DTD references.

If this property is not set, the current instance uses a new instance of the class with default credentials. If this property is set to , any external DTD or entities encountered by the reader are not resolved.

remarks.para: This property is write-only.

The is used to resolve the location of the file loaded into the reader and also to resolve DTD references. For example, if the XML included the DOCTYPE declaration, <!DOCTYPE book SYSTEM book.dtd>, the reader resolves this external file and ensures that the DTD is well-formed.
does not use the DTD for validation.
This property can be changed at any time and takes affect on the next read operation.

MemberSignature.Value: .property valuetype System.Xml.XmlSpace XmlSpace { public hidebysig virtual specialname valuetype System.Xml.XmlSpace get_XmlSpace() }

summary.para: Gets the current xml:space scope.

value.para: One of the members of the enumeration. If no xml:space scope exists, this property defaults to .

remarks.para: This property is read-only.

block.para: The class has no DTD information available; therefore, nodes are only returned when inside the scope of xml:space = "preserve".
